tool.name: NextDenovo
tool.description: string graph-based de novo assembler for long reads
tool.command: mkdir -p './read_files' && #for $index,$sample in enumerate($input_reads) #set $ext = $sample.ext ln -s '${sample}' './read_files/sample_${index}.${ext}' && #end for ls './read_files' -1 | sed -e 's|^|read_files/|' > './input.fofn' && cat '${configfile}' | sed -e "s/cores/\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}/g" | sed -e "s|memory|\$((\${GALAXY_MEMORY_MB:-8192}/1024))|g" > './configfile' && nextDenovo './configfile'

configfiles.configfile:
[General] job_type = local job_prefix = nextDenovo task = $task rewrite = yes deltmp = yes parallel_jobs = cores input_type = $input_type read_type = $read_type input_fofn = input.fofn
[correct_option] read_cutoff = $read_cutoff #if $genome_seed.selector == 'genome' genome_size = $genome_seed.genome_size # estimated genome size seed_depth = $genome_seed.seed_depth #else seed_cutoff = $genome_seed.seed_cutoff #end if blocksize = $blocksize sort_options = -m memoryg -t cores -k $ovl_parameters.max_depth_overlap -l $ovl_parameters.max_over_hang_length minimap2_options_raw = -t cores --minlen $minimap_parameters.minlen --minmatch $minimap_parameters.minmatch --minide $minimap_parameters.minide --kn $minimap_parameters.kn --wn $minimap_parameters.wn --cn $minimap_parameters.cn --maxhan1 $minimap_parameters.maxhan1 --maxhan2 $minimap_parameters.maxhan2 pa_correction = cores correction_options = -p cores
[assemble_option] minimap2_options_cns = -t cores nextgraph_options = -a $np.a $np.c $np.G $np.G $np.k $np.A -E $np.E -q $np.q -i $np.i -I $np.I -R $np.R -S $np.S -r $np.r -M $np.M -T $np.T -N $np.N -u $np.u -w $np.w -D $np.D -P $np.P -m $np.m -n $np.n -B $np.B -C $np.C -z $np.z -l $np.l -L $np.L -t $np.t -F $np.F

param.name: task
param.label: Task
param.option: Correct: only do the correction step
Assemble: only do the assembly step (only work if input type = corrected or read type = HiFi)

param.name: input_type
param.label: Input type
param.help: You can use raw or corrected reads.

param.name: read_type
param.label: Read type
param.option: HiFi: PacBio highly accurate long reads

param.name: read_cutoff
param.label: Read cutoff
param.help: filter reads with length smaller than read_cutoff

param.name: selector
param.label: Provide estimated genome size or seed cutoff
param.help: It is requried to perform some simple statistics (such as length distribution, total amount of data and sequencing depth) on the input data

param.name: genome_size
param.label: Estimated genome size
param.help: Estimated genome size, suffix K/M/G recognized, used to calculate seed_cutoff/seed_cutfiles/blocksize and average depth, it can be omitted when manually setting seed_cutoff. Spaces are not allowed.

param.name: seed_depth
param.label: Seed depth
param.help: Expected seed depth, used to calculate seed_cutoff, co-use with genome_size, you can try to set it 30-45 to get a better assembly result.

param.name: seed_cutoff
param.label: Seed cutoff
param.help: Minimum seed length. Set it to 0 for calculating it automatically.

param.name: blocksize
param.label: Block size
param.help: Block size for parallel running, split non-seed reads into small files, the maximum size of each file is blocksize.

param.name: max_depth_overlap
param.label: Max depth of each overlap
param.help: This value should be equal or smaller than the average sequencing depth.

param.name: max_over_hang_length
param.label: Max over hang length to filter

param.name: maxhan1
param.label: Maximum over hang length for re-align

param.name: maxhan2
param.label: Maximum over hang length for filtering contained reads

param.name: split
param.label: Split
param.help: Split the corrected seed with un-corrected regions

param.name: fast
param.label: Fast
param.help: 0.5-1 times faster mode with a little lower accuracy.

param.label: Output alternative contigs
param.help: For highly heterozygous genomes, it will increase assembly size.

param.label: Maximum test-to-best score ratio of a low quality edge
Minimum test-to-best depth ratio of an edge
Minimum valid nodes of a read
Depth of BFS to identify chimeric nodes
Maximum depth multiple of a node for BFS
Minimum depth multiple of a repeat node
Maximum depth multiple of a node
Maximum length of a compound path
Maximum length of a z branch
Maximum length of a short branch
Maximal length of a short loop
Maximal over hang length of dovetails

The read/seed length is too short, and the assembly result is unexpected and please check the assembly quality carefully.

tool.help: NextDenovo is a string graph-based de novo assembler for long reads (CLR, HiFi and ONT). It uses a "correct-then-assemble" strategy similar to canu (no correction step for PacBio HiFi reads), but requires significantly less computing resources and storages.
